intro: Caroxylon araneosum, commonly known as the spider plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically dark green with a waxy coating. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in summer, followed by bright red berries. It is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Caroxylon araneosum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
